title: (x) late 1960s serif face with interesting swashes - Bookman Swash (Jukebox Bookman) {Yves}
content:
I'm looking for a name on this one,  
Thanks...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027051141im_/http:/typophile.com/files/prev.jpg)
author: hubertyannickmean

comments.content: Bookman Swash, recently digitised by [Jason Walcott](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027051141/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jason%20Walcott) as [Jukebox Bookman](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027051141/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085)

Thank you.  
(swashes..not ligatures, where is my head)

Don'tchaworry, I knew what you meant. ;^)

Click the following links if you want more info on [swashes](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027051141/http:/typophile.com/wiki/swash) and [ligatures](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027051141/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ligature).
ITC seem to have the family. I remember disliking this font hugely many years ago, and avoiding it if possible. It has got better!

Hubert,

you might also like one of my favourites [DTL Elzevir](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027051141/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/ElzevirSwashBookItalic.html).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027051141im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Elz%20Swash%20Book%20Italic%201.GIF)

_\> ITC seem to have the family._

From the latest instalment of Bald Condensed:  
_"(...) I’d like to quickly point you all to another typeface often requested on the Typophile Type Identification Board that has finally made the transition to digital. Bookman Swash — not the wimpy blandified ITC version, but “the swashy original” — is boasted by Veer to be “the most comprehensive digital revival of the original ’70s delicacy”. Although I haven’t had the opportunity to test it, Jason Walcott’s Jukebox Bookman looks like it’s the real deal. It has all the vintage traits of the original Bookman — moderate x-height, higher contrast, obliques instead of italics — and the alternates are simply swashalicious."_

In other words, the ITC Version is not very good. :^/

Bookman swash,...on typophile  
Warning: The following images may be disturbing for some viewers

flair,flair, everywhere..
